guideline.success_criteria: input element or button is missing an associated label, it contains an alt attribute, or its label is empty

closest_fix.problem_type: input element or button is missing an associated label
closest_fix.CoT:
Sure, let's break it down step by step:
1. Look for all the input elements and buttons in the HTML.
2. Check if each input element or button has an associated label.
3. Check if each input element or button has an alt attribute.
4. Check if each label associated with an input element or button is empty.

guideline.success_criteria: <b> <i> or <font> tag should not be used

problem.problem: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. ...

closest_fix.problem_type: The <i> tag should not be used for italicizing text
closest_fix.offending_line: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. ...
closest_fix.fixed_line: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. ...
closest_fix.CoT:
1. Look through the HTML code for any instances of the `<i>` tag being used for italicizing text.

2. Look for any instances of the `<b>` tag being used for bold text.

3. Look for any instances of the `<font>` tag being used to change the font size, color, or face.

4. Identify all instances where these tags are used and suggest alternatives to improve accessibility and adhere to modern web standards.

guideline.success_criteria: element does not have complete start and end tags or id attribute is not unique

closest_fix.problem_type: element does not have complete start and end tags
closest_fix.CoT:
Sure, let's go step by step:

1. Check if all the elements have complete start and end tags.
2. Check if all the id attributes are unique.
